div.l: (base) ¶ The prohemie of the Clerkys tale of Oxenford
(base) ¶ ⁊and incipit prologus clerici de Oxon
(base) Here begynneth the prologue Of the clerke of Oxenford
(base) Sire clerk of Oxenford oure Hoost sayde
(base) Ye ride as coy and stille as dooth a mayde
(base) Were newe spoused sittyng at the bord
(base) This day ne herde I of your tonge a word
(base) I trowe ye studie aboute som Sophyme
(base) But Salomon seith euery thyng hath tyme
(base) For goddes sake as beth of bettre cheere
(base) It is no tyme for to studien heere
(base) Tel vs som murie tale by youre fey
(base) For what man that is entred in a pley
(base) He nedes moot vn to the pley assente
(base) But precheth nat as freres doon in lente
(base) To maken vs for oure olde synnes wepe
(base) Ne that thy tale make vs nat to slepe
(base) Tel vs som murye thyng of auentures
(base) Youre termes your colours and your figures
(base) Kepe hem in stoor til so be ye endite
(base) Heigh stile as whan that men to kynges write
(base) Speketh so pleyn at this tyme we yow preye
(base) That we may vnderstonde what ye seye

div.l: (base) This worthy clerk benygnely answerde
(base) Hoost quod he I am vnder your yerde
(base) Ye han of vs as now the gouernaunce
(base) And therfore wol I do yow obeisaunce
(base) As fer as reson asketh hardily
(base) I wol yow telle a tale which that I
(base) Lerned at Padwe of a worthy Clerk
(base) As proued by his wordes and his werk
(base) He is now deed and nayled in his Cheste
(base) I pray to god so yeue his soule reste
(base) Fraunceys Petrak the lauryat poete
(base) Highte this clerk whos Rethoryk swete
(base) Enlumyned al Ytaille of Poetrie
(base) As Lynyan dide of Philosophie
(base) Or lawe or oother art particuler
(base) But deth that wol nat suffre vs dwellen her
(base) But as it were a twynklyng of an eye
(base) Hem bothe hath slayn and alle shul we dye
(base) But forth to tellen of this worthy man
(base) That taughte me this tale as I bigan
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) I seye that first with heigh stile he enditeth
(base) Er he the body of his tale writeth
(base) A prohemie in which discryueth he
(base) Pemond and of Saluces the contree
(base) And speketh of Appenyn the hilles hye
(base) That been the boundes of westlumbardye
(base) And of Mount Vesulus in special
(base) Wher as the Poo out of a welle smal
(base) Taketh his firste spryngyng and his cours
(base) That Estward ay encresseth in his cours
(base) Wher as he holte euen streight wey his kurs
(base) To Emeleward to Ferare and Venyse
(base) The which a long thyng were to deuyse
(base) And trewely as to my Iuggement
(base) Me thynketh it a thyng inpertinent
(base) Saue that he wole convoien his matere
(base) But this his tale which that ye shal heere
(base) Here bigynneth the tale
(base) ¶ Explicit prohemim
(base) ¶ Incipit narrare

(base) And begynneth the clerkis
tale of Oxonford

div.l: (base) Ther is at the west syde of Ytaille
(base) Doun at the roote of vesulus the colde
(base) A lusty playne habundant of vitaille
(base) Wher many a tour and town thow mayst biholde
(base) That founded were in tyme of fadres olde
(base) And many another delitable sighte
(base) And Saluces this noble contree highte
(base) A Markys whilom lord was of that lond
(base) As were his worthy eldres hym bifore
(base) And obeysant ay redy to his hond
(base) Were alle his liges bothe lasse and moore
(base) Thus in delit he lyueth and hath doon yoore
(base) Biloued and drad thurgh fauour of Fortune
(base) Bothe of his lordes and of his commune
(base) Ther with he was to speke as of lynage
(base) The gentileste yborn of Lumbardye
(base) A fair persone and strong and yong of age
(base) And ful of honour and of curteisye
(base) Discret ynogh his contree for to gye
(base) Saue in some thynges that he was to blame
(base) And Walter was this yonge lordes name
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) I blame hym thus that he considered noght
(base) In tyme comynge what myghte hym bityde
(base) But on his lust persent was al his thoght
(base) As for to hauke and hunte on euery syde
(base) Wel neigh alle oothere cures leet he slyde
(base) And eek he nolde and that was worst of alle
(base) Wedde no wyf for noght that may bifalle
(base) Oonly that point his peple bar so soore
(base) That flokmele on a day they to hym wente
(base) And oon of hem that wisest was of loore
(base) Or ellis that the lord best wolde assente
(base) That he sholde telle hym what his peple mente
(base) Or ellis koude he shewe wel swich matere
(base) He to the Markys seyde as ye shal heere
(base) O noble Markys your humanitee
(base) Assureth vs and yeueth vs hardynesse
(base) As ofte as tyme is of necessitee
(base) That we to yow mowe telle oure heuynesse
(base) Accepteth lord now of your gentillesse
(base) That we with pitous herte vn to yow pleyne
(base) And lat youre erys noght my voys disdeyne
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) Al haue I noght to doone in this matere
(base) Moore than another man hath in this place
(base) Yet for as muche as ye my lord so deere
(base) Han alwey shewed me fauour and grace
(base) I dar the bettre aske of yow a space
(base) Of audience to shewen oure requeste
(base) And ye my lord to doon right as yow leste
(base) For certes lord so wel vs liketh yow
(base) And al youre werk and euere han doon that we
(base) Ne kouden nat vs self deuysen how
(base) We myghte lyuen in moore felicitee
(base) Saue o thyng lord if it your wille be
(base) That for to been a wedded man yow leste
(base) Thanne were your peple in souereyn hertes reste
(base) Boweth your nekke vnder that blisful yok
(base) Of souereyntee noght of seruyse
(base) Which that men clepe spousaille or wedlok
(base) And thenketh lord among your thoghtes wyse
(base) How that oure dayes passe in sondry wyse
(base) That of wedlok comes grete Emprice
(base) For thogh we slepe or wake or renne or ryde
(base) Ay fleeth the tyme it nel no man abyde
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) And thogh youre grene youthe floure as yit
(base) In crepeth age alwey as stille as stoon
(base) And deth manaceth euery age and smyt
(base) In ech estat for ther escapeth noon
(base) And also certeyn as we knowe echon
(base) That we shal dye as vncerteyn we alle
(base) Been of that day whan deth shal on vs falle
(base) Accepteth thanne of vs the trewe entente
(base) That neuere yet refuseden thyn heste
(base) And we wol lord if that ye wol assente
(base) Chese yow a wyf in short tyme at the leeste
(base) Born of the gentileste and of the meeste
(base) Of al this lond so that it oghte seme
(base) Honour to god and yow as we kan deme
(base) Delyuere vs out of al this bisy drede
(base) And tak a wyf for heighe goddes sake
(base) For if so bifelle as god forbede
(base) That thurgh youre deeth youre ligne sholde slake
(base) And that a straunge Successour sholde take
(base) Youre heritage o wo were vs alyue
(base) Wher fore we pray yow hastily to wyue
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) Hir meke prayere and hir pitous cheere
(base) Made the Markys herte han pitee
(base) Ye wol quod he myn owene peple deere
(base) To that I neuere erst thoghte streyne me
(base) I me reioysed of my libertee
(base) That selde tyme is founde in mariage
(base) Ther I was free I moot ben in seruage
(base) But nathelees I se your trewe entente
(base) And truste vp on youre wit and haue doon ay
(base) And truste vp on you and
(base) Wher fore of my free wyl I wol assente
(base) Wherfor of my fre wille I assente
(base) To wedde me as soone as euere I may
(base) But ther as ye han profred me to day
(base) To chese me a wyf I yow relesse
(base) That choys and pray yow of that profre cesse
(base) For god it woot that children ofte ben
(base) Vnlyk hir worthy eldres hem bifore
(base) Bountee comth al of god nat of the stren
(base) Of which they been engendred and ybore
(base) I triste in goddes bountee and therfore
(base) I truste in god and euer haue do by fore
(base) My mariage and myn estat and reste
(base) I hym bitake he may doon as hym leste
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) Lat me allone in chesyng of my wyf
(base) That charge vp on my bak I wol endure
(base) But I pray yow and charge vp on your lyf
(base) That what wyf that I take ye me assure
(base) To worshipe hire whil that hir lyf may dure
(base) In word and werk bothe here and euerywhere
(base) As she an Emperours doghter were
(base) And ferther moore this shal ye swere that ye
(base) Agayn my choys shal neither grucche ne stryue
(base) For sith I shal forgoon my libertee
(base) At your requeste as euere mote I thryue
(base) Ther as myn herte is set ther wol I wyue
(base) And but ye wol assente in swich manere
(base) I pray yow speketh namoore of this matere
(base) With hertly wyl they sworen and assenten
(base) To al this thyng ther seyde no wight nay
(base) Bisekynge hym of grace er that they wenten
(base) That he wolde graunten hem a certein day
(base) Of his spousaille as soone as euere I may
(base) For yet alwey the peple som what dredde
(base) Lest that the Markys no wyf wolde wedde

div.l: (base) ¶ Prima pars
(base) He graunted hem a day swich as hym leste
(base) On which he wolde be wedded sikerly
(base) And seyde he dide al this at hir requeste
(base) And they with humble entente buxomly
(base) Knelynge vp on hir knees ful reuerently
(base) Hym thanken alle and thus they han an ende
(base) Of hir entente and hom agayn they wende
(base) And her vp on he to his officers
(base) And here vpon he toke his officers
(base) Comaundeth for the feste to purueye
(base) And to his pryuee knyghtes and Squyers
(base) Swich charge yaf as hym liste on hem leye
(base) And they to his comandement obeye
(base) And ech of hem dooth al his diligence
(base) To doon vn to the feste reuerence
(base) Explicit prima pars
(base) Incipit pars secunda
(base) Noght fer fro thilke paleys honurable
(base) Wher as this Markys shoop his mariage
(base) Ther stood a Throop of site delitable
(base) In which that poure folk of that village
(base) Hadden hir bestes and hir herbergage
(base) And of hir labour token hir sustenance
(base) After that the erthe yaf hem habundance

div.l: (base) Among this poure folk ther dwelte a man
(base) Which that was holden pourest of hem alle
(base) But heighe god som tyme senden kan
(base) His grace in to a litel Oxes Stalle
(base) Ianicula men of that Throop hym calle
(base) A doghter hadde he fair ynogh to sighte
(base) And Grisildis this yonge mayden highte
(base) But for to speke of vertuous beautee
(base) Thanne was she oon the faireste vnder the sonne
(base) For poureliche yfostred vp was she
(base) No likerous lust was thurgh hir herte yronne
(base) Wel ofter of the welle than of the tonne
(base) She drank and for she wolde vertu plese
(base) She knew wel labour but noon ydel ese
(base) Hit was hir lust and hir most ese
(base) But thogh this mayde tendre were of age
(base) Yet in the brest of hir virginitee
(base) Ther was enclosed rype and sad corage
(base) And in gret reuerence and charitee
(base) Hir olde poure fader fostred she
(base) A fewe sheep spynnynge on feld she kepte
(base) She wolde noght been ydel til she slepte
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) And whan she homward cam she wolde brynge
(base) Wortes or othere herbes tymes ofte
(base) The whiche she shredde and seeth for his lyuynge
(base) And made hir bed ful harde and no thyng softe
(base) And ay she kepte hir fadres lyf on lofte
(base) With euery obeysance and diligence
(base) That child may doon to fadres reuerence
(base) Vp on Grisilde this poure creature
(base) Ful ofte sithe this Markys sette his eye
(base) As he on huntyng rood per auenture
(base) And whan it fil that he myghte hir espie
(base) He noght wit wantowne lookyng of folye
(base) Hise eyen caste on hir but in sad wyse
(base) Vp on hir cheere he wolde hym ofte auyse
(base) Commendynge in his herte hir wommanhede
(base) And eek hir vertu passyng any wight
(base) Of so yong age as wel in cheere as dede
(base) For thogh the peple hath no greet insight
(base) In vertue he considered ful right
(base) Hir bountee and disposed that he wolde
(base) Wedde hir oonly if euere he wedden sholde

div.l: (base) The day of weddyng cam but no wight kan
(base) Telle what womman that it sholde be
(base) For which merueille wondred many a man
(base) And seyden whan they were in priuetee
(base) Wol nat oure lord yet leue his vanytee
(base) Wol he nat wedde allas the while
(base) Why wol he thus hym self and vs bigyle
(base) But nathelees this Markys hath doon make
(base) Of gemmes set in gold and in Asure
(base) Broches and rynges for Grisildis sake
(base) And of hir clothyng took he the mesure
(base) Of a mayde lyk to hir stature
(base) And eek of othere aournementes alle
(base) That vn to swich a weddyng sholde falle
(base) The tyme of vndren of the same day
(base) Approcheth that this weddyng sholde be
(base) And al the palays put was in array
(base) Bothe halle and chambres ech in his degree
(base) Houses of office stuffed with plentee
(base) Ther maystow seen of deynteuous vitaille
(base) That may be founde as fer as last Ytaille

div.l: (base) This Roial Markys richeliche arrayed
(base) Lordes and ladys in his compaignye
(base) The whiche that to the feste were yprayed
(base) And of his retenue the Bachilrye
(base) With many a sown of sondry melodye
(base) Vn to the village of the which I tolde
(base) In this array the righte wey han holde
(base) Grisilde of this god woot ful Innocent
(base) That for hir shapen was al this array
(base) To fecchen water at a welle is went
(base) And cometh hom as soone as euer she may
(base) For wel she hadde herd seyd that thilke day
(base) The Markys sholde wedde and if she myghte
(base) She wolde fayn han seyn som of that sighte
(base) She thoghte I wole with othere maydens stonde
(base) That been my felawes in oure dore and se
(base) The Markisesse and therfore wol I fonde
(base) To doon at hom as soone as it may be
(base) The labour which that longeth vn to me
(base) And thanne I may at leyser hir biholde
(base) Yf she this wey vn to the Castel holde

div.l: (base) And as she wolde ouer the thresshfold gon
(base) The Markys cam and gan hir for to calle
(base) And she sette doun hir water pot anon
(base) Bisyde the thresshfold in an Oxes Stalle
(base) And doun vp on hir knees she gan to falle
(base) Thought she sayde but let him alon
(base) And with sad contenance kneleth stille
(base) Til she hadde herd what was the lordes wille
(base) This thoghtful Markys spak vn to this mayde
(base) Ful sobrely and seyde in this manere
(base) Where is youre fader o Grisildis he sayde
(base) And she with reuerence in humble cheere
(base) Answerde lord he is al redy heere
(base) And she goth with outen lenger lette
(base) And to the Markys she hir fader fette
(base) He by the hand than took this olde man
(base) And seyde thus whan he hym hadde asyde
(base) Ianicula I neither may ne kan
(base) Lenger the plesance of myn herte hyde
(base) If that thow vouche sauf what so bityde
(base) Thy doghter wol I take er that I wende
(base) As for my wyf vn to my lyues ende

div.l: (base) Thow louest me I woot it wel certeyn
(base) And art my feithful lige man ybore
(base) And al that liketh me I dar wel seyn
(base) It liketh thee and specially ther fore
(base) Tel me that point that I haue seyd bifore
(base) If that thow wolt vn to that purpos drawe
(base) To take me as for thy sone in lawe
(base) The sodeyn cas this man astoneyd so
(base) That reed he weex abayst and al quakyng
(base) He stood vnnethe seyde he wordes mo
(base) But oonly this lord quod he my willyng
(base) Is as ye wole ne ayeins youre likyng
(base) I wol no thyng ye be my lord so deere
(base) Right as yow list gouerneth this matere
(base) Yet wol I quod this Markys softely
(base) That in thy chambre I and thow and she
(base) Haue a collacioun and wostow why
(base) For I wol aske if it hir wille be
(base) To be my wyf and rule hir after me
(base) And al this shal be doon in thy persence
(base) I wol noght speke out of thyn audience

div.l: (base) And in the chambre whil they were aboute
(base) Hir tretys which as ye shal after heere
(base) The peple cam vn to the hous with oute
(base) And wondred hem in how honeste manere
(base) And tentifly she kepte hir fader deere
(base) But outrely Grisildis wondre myghte
(base) But veraily wundir they myght
(base) For neuere eft ne saw she swich a sighte
(base) No wonder is thogh that she were astoned
(base) To seen so greet a gest come in to place
(base) She neuere was to swiche gestes woned
(base) For which she looked with ful pale face
(base) But shortly forth this matere for to chace
(base) Thise arn the wordes that this Markys sayde
(base) To this benygne verray feithful mayde

(base) It liketh to youre fader and to me

(base) As I suppose ye wol that it so be
(base) As I suppose that ye wele that it may so be

(base) But this demaunde I aske firste quoth he
(base) That sith it shal be doon in hastif wyse

div.l: (base) I sey this be ye redy with good herte
(base) To al my lust and that I frely may
(base) As me best thynketh do yow laughe or smerte
(base) And neuere ye to grucche it nyght ne day
(base) And eek whan I sey ye ne sey nat nay
(base) Neither by word ne frownyng contenance
(base) Swere this and heere I swere oure alliance
(base) Wondrynge vp on this word quakyng for drede

(base) I am to thilke honour that ye me bede
(base) But as ye wol your self right so wol I
(base) And heere I swere that neuere willyngly
(base) In werk ne thoght I nel yow disobeye
